page.title: 02General History
page.content: The area has a rich history, and was first settled in by the Saxons. Alvechurch was established by King Offa, King of the Mercians, in 780 A.D. In 850 A.D Alhun, Bishop of Worcester gave most of the land to King Berhtwulf, and eventually in 934 A.D. it was tranferred to the lands of the Church of St. Mary, Worcester. Alvechurch was mentioned in the Domesday Book and was 13 hides,had a demesne, 2 ploughs, 1 priest, a reeve, a riding man, 12 villeins, and 7 bordars. In the Middle Ages, the seat of the Augustinian Bishop of Worcester was in Alvechurch in the form of the Bishops Palace. Legend says that the village witnessed savage fighting in 1265. In the 14th. century the area was visited by plague, and many were killed including the bishop in his palace.
